dcterms:creator: V. Mnih
K. Kavukcuoglu
D. Silver
A. Graves
I. Antonoglou
D. Wierstra
M. Riedmiller
dcterms:description: The LunarLander environment simulates the physics problem of gently lowering a vehicle down to a landing pad. It has a discrete action space with four choices: left thrust, right thrust, bottom thrust, or do nothing.
dcterms:title: LunarLander

dcterms:creator: A. Moore
dcterms:description: The MountainCar environment requires the agent to drive a vehicle up a mountain to reach the top, using momentum from a small hill to achieve the goal. It has a discrete action space with three options: accelerate left, do nothing, or accelerate right.
dcterms:title: MountainCar

dcterms:description: Robo is an environment of the authors' own design, set in a 10x10 gridworld configured as a maze. The agent's goal is to navigate to a specified square in the maze, with actions to go forward, turn left, or turn right.
dcterms:title: Robo
